p: Multivariate analysis based on the leaf volatiles classified the cultivars into four groups ( Figure 3). Group I exhibited a similarity level of 99.2% between the cultivars “Equador” and “Guajarina”, and presented high levels of γ-elemene (38.33–44.36%), curzerene (23.21–23.39%) and δ-elemene (6.83–13.84%). This group displayed a similarity of 53.6% with group II. High concentrations of δ-elemene (30.11–50.89%) characterized the group II with a similarity level of 92.3% among the cultivars “Iaçará”, “Kottanadan”, and “Cingapura”.
